text: General elections were held in Nepal on 3 and 17 May 1999. The Nepali Congress emerged as the largest party, gaining 28 seats, while the Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist) (CPNâ€“UML) lost 17. ==Results== ===Distribution of seats=== Image:Nc-map1999.PNG|Seats won by Nepali Congress Image:Uml-map1999.PNG|Seats won by CPN(UML) Image:Rpp-map1999.PNG|Seats won by Rashtriya Prajatantra Party Image:Left-map1999.PNG|Seats won by Rashtriya Jana Morcha, Samyukta Janamorcha Nepal and Nepal Workers Peasants Party ==Related pages== *List of MPs elected in the 1999 Nepalese general election == References == Category:General elections Nepal Category:20th century in Nepal Category:Politics of Nepal
title: 1999 Nepalese general election
